The respondent, Olisa Agbakoba, a prominent Nigerian lawyer and human rights activist, had his international passport seized by the State Security Service (SSS, now known as DSS). Agbakoba challenged this action, arguing that it infringed upon his constitutional right to freedom of movement as guaranteed under the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, 1999. The case escalated through the judicial system, ultimately reaching the Supreme Court of Nigeria, the highest court in the land, whose decisions are final as per Section 235 of the 1999 Constitution.
